meanings.definition: A distinctive frequency component of a sound wave.
meanings.sent1: The formants in his voice made it easy to recognize him over the phone.
meanings.sent2: The formants in the music helped create a unique melody.
meanings.sent3: The formants in the song were so clear, it sounded like the singer had a special code.
meanings.sent4: The formants of the bird's chirp stood out among the other sounds in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The formants of the alarm were so sharp, it woke up the entire neighborhood.

meanings.sent1: The formants of her handwriting were elegant and flowing.
meanings.sent2: The formants of the building's architecture reflected a modern style.
meanings.sent3: The formants of his dance moves were so unique, everyone wanted to learn them.
meanings.sent4: The formants of the painting's colors created a sense of harmony.
meanings.sent5: The formants of the puzzle pieces fit together perfectly, revealing a beautiful picture.
